file_content.text: You were pretty harsh. If the Council had listened to your recommendation, I'd be locked up.
I was only doing my job, Padawan.
It wasn't personal.
Your job. Right.
Keep up that attitude and you'll find out just how harsh I can be.
That can still be arranged.
I have a pretty clear idea of that.
Just so you know, I won't hold a grudge about this. Wouldn't be very Jedi-like.
Let's get back to work, Master.
Don't think I didn't notice the risk you took by standing up for me.
That's the second time you made me have an inappropriate urge. Knock it off.
I never felt this close to Master Kiwiiks. Your support was... special.
I felt stronger having you there. You're a good Master--and a good friend.
I'll always help you however I can, Kira. That's my job as your teacher.
Just doing my duty.
You do more than any Master should, and I'm grateful for it.
Anytime. I'm just glad we're staying a team.
[Flirt] It was my pleasure.
That goes double for me.
Thanks. I'll keep that in mind.
We're in this together. I know you'd do the same for me.
You're welcome.
I would now. After this, I owe you a few dozen....
I won't risk my reputation for you again.
Time for you to grow up.
I'll be on my best behavior from here on out. Padawan's honor.
Glad that's finally over. For a minute I thought the Jedi Council might lock me up.
That would've been anti-climactic. Our mission's not done yet. Ready to get back to work?
Let's show Darth Angral and the Emperor they can't push us around.
As long as you're with me.
The Council gave you a free pass, but they can't make me trust you.
I'll be watching you.
No. That's my job.
Ready to go whenever you are, Master.
Just because you're staying doesn't mean you're going out on missions. Ever.
You're never leaving my ship.
Cutting me out of the loop, huh? That's your mistake to make.
If you leave me on the ship all the time, I might be forced to redecorate it while you save the galaxy.
Look on the bright side... now you know all my dark secrets. No more surprises here.
You were going to abandon me. No questions, no chance to explain.
I wouldn't have let him take you. I was only trying to keep him off balance.
I was bluffing.
I saw how you looked at me.
I just found out you and the Emperor are relatives. What did you expect?
Can you blame me?
You don't know the whole story.
I can't imagine any explanation that will make me trust you again.
There's no point.
I don't expect trust. I'll settle for you knowing who I really am.
Thanks for sticking by me. I know this was a big shock, but I can explain.
I should've told you the truth a long time ago.
My parents were Sith--but the Emperor isn't my father. "Child of the Emperor" is just a title.
I was taken from my parents when I was a baby. Raised in the Sith Academy with others like Valis. It was... brutal.
I can only imagine the pain you must have endured.
I'm sorry.
Pain became normal. There were worse things.
Why raise you in the Sith Academy? What were you being trained for?
What was the purpose?
About what you'd expect. Learn how to kill Jedi and do other horrible things. But that wasn't all.
You've been taught the ways of the dark side.
So, you're a trained Sith.
Sort of. Never been much of a student--and some things I'd rather forget.
Every so often, the other Children were taken to see our "father." They came back different. Nobody ever remembered meeting the Emperor.
One day, I realized I couldn't remember anything from the past week. They were doing the same thing to me.
I'm starting to understand. You escaped the Sith, didn't you?
So you ran away.
Nobody treats me like a droid and gets away with it.
Whatever the Sith did, it's buried in your memories. We have to uncover it.
We need to know what happened.
I've tried. Every time I get close to a memory, it changes. Slithers away.
All I'm hearing is you're a liar and you're crazy.
I can't trust you at all.
I'm not crazy. Sometimes I can almost remember what happened... but it's like something out of a nightmare.
I was still a child then. Small enough to stow away on a supply ship leaving Imperial space.
Lived in lots of bad places until I met Master Kiwiiks. She brought me to the Jedi. Changed my life.
Did you tell Master Kiwiiks about your past?
Does she know the truth?
No. How would I even begin? "By the way, I was born a Sith. Is that a problem?"
You've been keeping secrets, Kira. That's not what Jedi do.
Not enough, apparently.
That stupid old woman brought an enemy into our ranks.
Kiwiiks was a fool.
She's not stupid. Maybe I'm not the best Jedi, but I'm no Sith either.
Always knew sooner or later I'd have to come clean. Just hoped I could prove myself as a Jedi first.
Now the Emperor knows where I am, the Sith will never stop hunting me.
Master Satele and the others need to know about this.
We should tell the Council.
They'll take you over my dead body.
[Flirt] I'll protect you.
I can't figure you out. A minute ago you were about to abandon me here.
I'm having a very inappropriate urge to kiss you... but I won't.
I'm surprised you still talk to me after all this.
You're my Padawan, Kira. I made a promise to keep you safe.
I won't let them touch you.
I know I haven't been a great Padawan, but I'm going to try harder.
I'm ready to tell the truth--Master Kiwiiks, the Jedi Council, everyone. No more secrets.
We should probably let the general know he's not getting his admiral.
You're more trouble than you're worth. First chance I get, I'm dumping you off on Tython.
You're a liability.
Fine. Turn me in to the Council. I bet they'll be more open-minded.
Let's go. The general's waiting to hear from you.
I don't like it. This mission has "trap" written all over it.
